issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

App was working an installing fine in 1.6.0. I recently upgraded to 1.6.1.

Now, I build (in fact do a clean/total rebuild), then move the .app to iTunes (this is on a MacBook, Mac OS X v10.6.6), by the usual drag-and-drop method. Perform a sync, and get the following message, after the app uploads":

The app "xxxxxxxxxx" was not installed on the iPod "yyyyyyyyyy" because an unknown error occurred (0xE800801C).

The app does not get installed onto the iPod, but is still on iTunes.

Note, this also happens with the Kitchen Sink app as well.
(Also note, everything works in the iOS/iPhone emulator... no problem.)

FYI:
Titanium SDK version: 1.6.1
iPhone SDK version: 4.2
Mac OS X version: 10.6.6
(Titanium Developer version: 1.2.2)

Please help!
- Chris

{html}
fields.summary: Upgrade to 1.6.1 - Apps no longer install on Ipod

comments.body:
{html}

Does not seem to be an Apple issue, per se. I load an old version of the app, created using Titanium Mobile 1.6.0, onto iTunes and it installs and runs fine. This seems to have something to do with 1.6.1.

Is no one else encountering this issue?

{html}
